column4: does anyone know why my apache2 wont let me change the /cgi-bin/ dir??
maybe it has something to do with apache using different files for different sites?
i dont have any vhosts, i just apt-get installed apache2 and libapache2-mod-perl2 but i want to change the location of cgi-bin, and the apache2.conf doesnt haev a SriptAlias directory
I know, but _IIRC_ apache puts the config in a separate file
I dont have apache2 installed right now so I cant be more specific
the only config file i'm aware of is apache2.conf..the other is httpd.conf but it's empty
let me connect my laptop to the power and ill try and see
thanks man i appreciate it
booting
/etcapache2sites-enabled
/etc/apache2/sites-enabled
000-default ScriptAlias is right there
wtf, amazing...i had no idea apache2 did that
got it?
thanks a lot..yeah i found it :D
I had never seen this setup before, I think its a debian thing
it must be because i used apache2 on slackware for my server and it all wen tin one file
I gotta admit this way is more practical
yeah it's a little strange though..is this the same as the vhosts thing?
and 000-default is just a catchall vhost
no, just chmod it
